snippet: An acidly worded decision raised a broader question about whether a cabinet secretary can decide on a drug’s availability for reasons other than its safety and effectiveness.
abstract: Federal Judge Edward R Korman orders that Plan B morning-after pill be made available over the counter for all ages, instead of requiring prescription for girls 16 and younger; hotly-worded decision accuses Obama administration and Health and Human Services secretary Kathleen Sebelius of political motivation when they restricted sale of drug in 2011.

byline.contributor: Michael D. Shear and Sabrina Tavernise contributed reporting.

lead_paragraph: An acidly worded decision raised a broader question about whether a cabinet secretary can decide on a drug’s availability for reasons other than its safety and effectiveness.

headline.seo: Judge Orders F.D.A. to Make Morning-After Pill Available Over the Counter for All Ages
headline.main: Judge Strikes Down Age Limits on Morning-After Pill
headline.print_headline: Judge Overturns Age Limit To Buy A Contraceptive
